website_summaries.verdict: Let imaginations run wild with this building kit complete with child-sized tools.
pros: Use more than 160 construction pieces to build towers, vehicles, animals, and more
Real tools help your child build fine motor skills
cons: May not have enough bricks to build every item on the instruction sheet if your child doesn't want to disassemble what they already built

customer_reviews.title: Failure of a great idea
customer_reviews.text: This is an engaging toy that wins on so many fronts but alas, they blew it. I wonder if perhaps this toy was down-sized from its original and no one bothered to re-engineer it once scaled down. For the pictured projects, only some of which there are enough parts to construct, pieces interfere with other pieces so they cannot go together or the wheels turn in the configurations shown. My kiddo can still put pieces together in ways that satisfy his desire to build but we will pitch the instructions to spare him frustration and disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: realkaren

customer_reviews.title: TEACHER AND MOMMY APPROVED!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this product-- it's my second time purchasing it! The first purchase, I left at my old job in great hands. For an entire year, my kids went above and beyond to create awesome things. I trust that this year at my new job, it will be the same. With a larger class now, I purchased the larger kit and "tinkering station" has been a hit. Worth every penny, and will be getting another set for my tot once he gets a little older! Perfect for hand-eye coordination and fine motor skills.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan's Mom

customer_reviews.title: Lacks step by step instructions. High price
customer_reviews.text: No instructions supplied for the "42 ways to use this set". The child was really disappointed in lack of instructions. He was not interested in the beginner car demonstrated but rather wanted an airplane off the sheet, yet no instructions for him to do it himself. Toys like these are meant to keep kids occupied without active help from the parent. Stating it is appropriate for a three year old is a stretch. Cost too much as is.
customer_reviews.author: AlinaVIPG

customer_reviews.title: Best building toy ever
customer_reviews.text: Best building toy ever! We construct all types of vehicles and creatures for and with our three year old. (He uses the provided tools to tighten the nuts and bolts in place while we hold the parts and encourage "righty-tighty, lefty-loosey.") His cousin can build with it independently (she's almost 6). We laminated the example sheet with clear adhesive shelf paper making the paper almost as durable as the colorful building pieces. Have already purchased more sets for other kids. Thank you, Nancy H.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy R. Hoagland

customer_reviews.title: Great Toy Set for Any Age
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my grand son who will turn three shortly. He loves it. His nine year old sister loves it as well. It's like a modern day erector set. He set it up in various shapes around his train set. Reminds me of toys from my childhood. Makes him think and use his imagination.
customer_reviews.author: JDS

customer_reviews.title: One of the pieces snapped in literally 10 minutes of play
customer_reviews.text: Not sure if that piece was defective, but it literally snapped in the middle within 10 minutes of play! Contemplating to return as defective. After that we played almost another hour but no other piece broke. Can't tell how long it will last. We like the concept and our 3 year old twins were already trying to screw in few pieces. Wish I could get replacement of the broken piece. Also, I would pay at least double for a more quality set with heavier more durable plastic pieces. Not sure if such a quality exists anymore :(
customer_reviews.author: Bookworm

customer_reviews.title: The diagrams are easy to follow and pieces are perfect size for his ...
customer_reviews.text: The diagrams are easy to follow and pieces are perfect size for his little hands. I bought these for my 4 year old great grandson. He was intrigued by the diagrams, colors, pieces and tools. He literally played with it for hours building most of the items listed. Looking forward to purchasing the bigger set.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara

customer_reviews.title: Great toy for kids. Easy to use. Little adult help needed to assemble.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 5 and 3- year old boys and they've been fascinated by it. It kept them busy for hours. Great educational toy. I loved that it came with its own storage box. I would have loved if the quantity per piece was stated on the manual to help keep tabs on when we miss a piece.
customer_reviews.author: Toks

customer_reviews.title: Happy Child
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this a birthday gift for a 4 year old and mom reports that he LOVES this. It is very easy to build things independently and the pieces are sturdy. I am considering checking out one of the kits for my 7 year old.
customer_reviews.author: LadyRedd

customer_reviews.title: Small
customer_reviews.text: Overall the product was smaller than I expected and therefore I paid more for it than I would have had I seen it in person before purchasing...I think around $15 Max is a more reasonable price for this. But my kids love to build stuff! So hopefully it will be worth every penny in the long run. And they are NOT as small as Legos so less pain on your feet ;)
customer_reviews.author: Aleisha

customer_reviews.title: box was broken when arrived
customer_reviews.text: i ordered first toy, and found the box was broken. so i ordered a replacement. And the replacement toy also had a broken box. I kind of given up on trying to order a replacement for the replacement.... It may be a great toy, but I guess I will never find out.
customer_reviews.author: Caty

customer_reviews.title: Only received balloons
customer_reviews.text: Like many of the other reviews, we also only received the balloons. Now we're having to go through the hassle of returning it. You can always try your luck to see if you get everything, just make sure you have enough time to purchase the things you need if you only end up receiving the balloons.
customer_reviews.author: ex512

customer_reviews.title: Easy to follow instructional sheet for assembling
customer_reviews.text: This toy kit was bought for my neice’s sons age 3 and 5. They really enjoyed constructing all the various models shown in the instructions which were very easy for them to follow. Instruction sheet had color pictures showing all the different parts used for each model. This item was a big hit with them!
customer_reviews.author: slspdr11513

customer_reviews.title: Best gift ever!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 3 yr old daughter for her birthday because we had to give her something. She is quite spoiled by family, has tons of toys and plays with very few of them. She absolutely loves this and asks everyday to play with it. She will sit and build for at least 20 minutes. No other toy keeps her attention that long, besides playdoh. This set comes with 8 wheels, others don't. You need 8 because no one wants to make just one car and then have to take it apart to build a new car.
customer_reviews.author: Joy

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced Junk!
customer_reviews.text: Small, did I say SMALL box of cheap plastic parts for $30.00! A total disappointment! Bought as a last minute gift for a 7 year old. Amazon delivered on time, thank you, BUT.... Not age appropriate as advertised for 3 to 10 year olds. Looks like a baby toy. Don’t waste big bucks on a small box of plastic junk worth maybe $10 at Dollar General.
customer_reviews.author: txteacherlady

customer_reviews.title: These are really fun. My son loves them
customer_reviews.text: These are really fun. My son loves them. But they’re not the greatest quality. I’ve already had several pieces break. The wheels especially.
customer_reviews.author: Brynniedapooh

customer_reviews.title: A hit construction toy!
customer_reviews.text: This toy is very fun. My son hasn't yet learned how to screw in nuts and bolts, but he's very interested in attaching wheels to the blocks. There are so many things that you can build using these construction blocks. I love it! I had received some defective parts, so I contacted the seller. He then sent me a few extra parts in the mail very quickly, which was very helpful. Thank you! It's an excellent toy that will help my child improve his fine motor skills. 👍 It comes with a reference guide on some things you can build using these blocks, but you can definitely build more and it's very enjoyable to play with.
customer_reviews.author: Tabby

customer_reviews.title: Grandson Loves!
customer_reviews.text: Order and delivery went smoothly and on-time. I watch my grandsons three days a week and went online to look for some new activities now that we will be indoors more with the weather turning cooler. My grandson's eyes (the one who will be four next month) lit up as soon as he saw the container. He proceeded to play for a couple of hours on his own, while I played with his little brother. Later in the afternoon, he was back playing with the set. I anticipate we'll get many hours of stimulating play from this building set. Can't wait to add more sets. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Pamela M.

customer_reviews.title: Not Impressed
customer_reviews.text: I am surprised at the number of positive reviews for this toy. When we received the box, I wasn't expecting it to be so small. There isn't a lot to say about this toy except that it is overpriced. Neither of my kids seem interested. Wish we had bought more of the magnetic blocks.
customer_reviews.author: Brickhouse

customer_reviews.title: My 3 and a half yr old son who has ...
customer_reviews.text: My 3 and a half yr old son who has autism, absolutely loves your product, He does not get overwhelmed and the different things he can build keeps his mind fresh
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Not for 7 years old!
customer_reviews.text: I brought this as a Christmas gift for my 7 year old nephew. The ages listed on here listed most ages and the review was good, so I decided to get it so he can build different things and improve his brain along the way. I was wrong on my part because the age says 3 years old and it is not something that a 7 year old is going to look forward to playing with at all. The design is for kids 3 and up like it says and the design is made for toddlers. More than likely I will be returning if I can not find an age appropriate child to gift it to
customer_reviews.author: alltowardsyou

customer_reviews.title: 5 star rating approved by 2 three year olds a four year old, and grandma!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this 101 piece STEM toys kit on Amazon Prime Day. My 3 grandson's love it. I bought a second kit within days as everything they wanted to build needed wheels, so I needed more. Perfect for play at Grandma's house. It comes in a nie plastic bin with a lid which was a nice surprise for me. It didn't take long for 2 three year olds and a four year old to master how to build. And it holds there interest and makes for quiet play which I so enjoy!!
customer_reviews.author: Lindy Lou

customer_reviews.title: Missing pieces
customer_reviews.text: This is sold as a toy for more than one child to use at a time but there are not enough of the block pieces they are all little pieces and I did not receive 163 pieces as advertised. I contacted the company and did not get a response. They sell extra big parts but they are expensive on shipping and should have been included. Do not buy for a class activity. Only enough for one child to build.
customer_reviews.author: preschool teacher

customer_reviews.title: My 5-year old grandson loves this!
customer_reviews.text: The pieces are sturdy, colorful, and well made. My grandson was able to copy some of the suggested projects by studying the accompanying pamphlet illustrations, although the illustrations are not step-by-step. He also enjoys making up his own projects. It's nice that there are so many wheels provided and enough pieces so that a project doesn't have to be cannibalized in order to make additional items.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Lee Carlyon

customer_reviews.title: All 4 Boys Love It
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my 4 grandsons (age 4 to 6), and all 4 of them love them. They typically have to earn “tablet time” with learning activities, but yesterday, after they earned their tablet time, they asked if they could play with these instead of their tablets. They look at the pictures and make the designs. The 48 different project designed are sorted by difficulty (#1 is the easiest, #48 is the most difficult), and they’ve only had them for a week, and they’ve already worked into the 20s. Building big STEM brains without even trying.
customer_reviews.author: C. Parker

customer_reviews.title: Many problems using this toy to actually make anything
customer_reviews.text: only one length of screw means it's super limited as to how many pieces can be bolted together. Wheels rub on whichever block they are mounted to. Almost impossible to make spinning airplane, helicopter, ferris wheel type of thing because of the limited bolt length selection. To be honest, I feel 3 stars to be too generous. My 3 and six year old can't figure out how to make anything with it. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Gordon B. West

customer_reviews.title: Very well thought out
customer_reviews.text: Kit comes with numerous tools and pieces enabling 2 to 3 kids to play simultaneously. I was really impressed with the tools, specifically because many of the wrenches include a ratchet mechanism to prevent overtightening! Much opportunity for kids to be creative, and they are enjoying playing with it and not tiring of it immediately.
customer_reviews.author: G. Dietrich

customer_reviews.title: The box holding the small pieces was received broken! ...
customer_reviews.text: The box holding the small pieces was received broken!! That was very inconvenient since it had sharp end and could injure my kid.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: My 4 yr old grandson loved it!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this last February but all 3 grandsons were too young to really appreciate it, so I held onto it for Christmas. At 4 yrs 10 mos, the eldest one received it. He was confused about how the pieces fit together, so his dad sat on the floor with him and they ended up making a couple of different vehicles together. My daughter told me a couple of weeks later that he had been playing with it non-stop. That was great to hear, especially since this is a STEM toy set. I'm back online today to see if there are any add-on sets to get him for his 5th birthday.
customer_reviews.author: Mamaskia

customer_reviews.title: This is a great toy! My daughter doesn’t have any siblings close ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great toy! My daughter doesn’t have any siblings close in age to her and she doesn’t like to play by herself. When we opened the package she immediately started playing with it and was entertained for quite a long time. Then she said, “Look Mom! I’m playing by myself!” Definitely worth buying and a great value for a great toy!
customer_reviews.author: Lydia Rich

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding! Very educational first engineering toy
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding! Very educational first engineering toy. Both the people that designed and made this should win awards. So beautiful, sturdy, practical. Please add many more parts, wheels and connectors! Maybe a motor or two in each box! Maybe even gears and levers! Loved by kids and parents, perfect for playing together and building stuff. Much more fun than lego by far. Maybe by a factor of 5. Never feels like work, unlike lego. Instructions not even required for building amazing constructs of different types. How do I give this 10 stars?
customer_reviews.author: Ugochukwu Nwogwugwu

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I got this to use in my pre-k classroom. My students have not had a chance to test them out yet but I believe they will love it. It was exactly what I was looking for. My husband had to play with it before I took it to school. He loved it and said if he had this item as a child he would have spent hours building.
customer_reviews.author: Beverly Grubbs

customer_reviews.title: Getting ahead of the STEM learning curve.
customer_reviews.text: Mike. Thank you. I sent this as a gift for my grandson who is 4 yrs old. I understand the importance of STEM learning and I appreciate the chance to purchase a toy like this. From all accounts especially from my daughter, my grandson really enjoys the toy and it’s benefits. You couldn’t beat the price for a birthday present, the convenience of quick delivery, since I almost forgot and most of all for my grandson to get interested in STEM.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel A. Tong

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size for little hands.
customer_reviews.text: The pices are big and colorful. Come in a closed container, sealed with plastic. I bought it as a gift for my grandson’s birthday. Will have to wait until April to evaluate this product. The package was finally open today, because it was a birthday gift. Been able to see the parts up close outside the box and play with them briefly, I can say that they are excellent for the children’s imagination.
customer_reviews.author: Carmen B

customer_reviews.title: A really great toy to promote creativity and construction skills
customer_reviews.text: This product is basically the newer form of my old Erector set...but with improvements and being more age appropriate for younger children. My just turned 5 grandson loves the set...he invents and creates things to give to my wife and I when he visits...keeps him occupied for long stretches. Very colorful and has illustrations of easy to make "projects" so he can figure out just how they go together. He took parts home to use, and needed more here, so we got another set..price is reasonable. I can see how they would be great in a school setting, too!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent stem blocks.
customer_reviews.text: Overall, these blocks are really excellent, even though our 7 yr old granddtr lost interest after assembling her first project. Our 5 yr. old grandson, on the other hand, had trouble assembling his first project at Christmas 2019. Since then, however, he has played with them off and on as he matures and his interest grows. They are age appropriate, for sure, depending on each child. Thank you. June 9, 2020.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck

customer_reviews.title: My Son LOVES This!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for Christmas and my son and I still play with this and have become very creative. We created a tunnel for his Thomas train to be able to go under! We have also created most of the items on the sheet that's included with the item.
customer_reviews.author: Dimplz

customer_reviews.title: Great value, product and purchase experience.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent buy. My niece (3) and nephew (4) received this for Christmas and it is really all that they play with. The only regret that I have is not buying the largest pack. 101 pieces is more than enough until you get another kid or two to play, then I think that the larger box would have been a better option. Regardless, It is a value purchase, sturdy pieces and tools, vibrant colors and it was delivered before I even expected to receive it. Five stars.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I really like the idea book
customer_reviews.text: I really like the idea book. The building ideas are laid out in a progressive fashion. Right from the start the builder is rewarded with making something they can identify. The photos are clear enough to figure out what pieces are needed, at least with the simpler models. I haven't worked on the harder ones yet. I hope they will expand the idea book.
customer_reviews.author: Cris Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: I think these are good. I would buy them again. My four year old son was able to put together the projects form the very first time he used them with no help from me. I am giving them four stars because he used them for two solid hours for two days, and then has not shown as keen an interest since. He has several other siblings who like to use them too, so they were still worth getting them for me, but I wished he would play with them more regularly.
customer_reviews.author: Corrina

customer_reviews.title: A wonderfully well made building set
customer_reviews.text: I did not believe the age spread advertised- but the construction set has been a huge success with bothy my 5 year old and and 3 year old great grandchildren . Upon opening the handy storage box, they immediately started to build all kinds of imaginary objects with great success.. The parts are extremely well made, fit well into each other and the colors help to identify the various pieces. I can highly recommend this set to anyone who has kids who like to build.
customer_reviews.author: kofpa

customer_reviews.title: Great STEM toy for kids.
customer_reviews.text: My daughter (4 yo) and I have been building one or two of these a day while in quarantine. She loves using the wrenches, ratchets and screwdrivers. We are very happy we went with the larger kit, she can build a hard one and we can build a smaller one for her (1 yo) brother. Great gift and toy. Some small parts for young kids. We watch our son carefully when he has his little sister made toy.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Best Toy Ever!
customer_reviews.text: Great toy for kids who enjoy building and creating things. Got this set after buying a smaller for my 4 year old twins to share, but that one only came with 6 wheels and they needed more wheels. This set comes with 8 wheels and more wrenches, which are very easy to use for them. my twins love it so much, this toy is never out away. It always stays in my coffee table. They have been playing with it everyday since they got it for the past 3 weeks. The instructions for the designs are good as well.
customer_reviews.author: Ana Quinonez

customer_reviews.title: Great Gift for Kids
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this 163 piece Stem Toys Kit for my grandchildren to use when they visit my house. They love the variety and the kit can keep them occupied for hours. They have become very creative and invented many new toys with which to play. The kit is colorful and easy to use. They stir the creativity of children and allow kids to produce many interesting toys. What a great value!
customer_reviews.author: Jadda

customer_reviews.title: Better Than Legos!
customer_reviews.text: This little builder kit comes in a sturdy container with handles so they are easy to keep together. The reason I say they are better than legos is because there are little tools to use as they build and imagine
customer_reviews.author: Victoria Gunderson

customer_reviews.title: Very very good toy to buy!
customer_reviews.text: This construction blocks are very neat! The set contains a lot of pieces which allow a child to assembly a variety of projects. I bought it for my 5-year-old son but believe it will work for a kid starting from 3 years old as stated in the description, however, it might be not as interesting for a 7-year-old. It is perfect if you want your child to develop not only imagination but also his fine motor skills. The set includes the images of ideas of what can be assembled, it also arrived in a nice storage container. I highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: S A

customer_reviews.title: Great set, tools maybe be challenge
customer_reviews.text: Great set. Only issue is that the screwdriver is too hard to use for younger kids. My 5 yr old grandson struggled with it tI'll mom showed him he could use his fingers to tighten nuts and bolts. Then it went really well. If not for that I'd give it a five but that particular issue made me feel not as age appropriate as indicated.
customer_reviews.author: Carol

customer_reviews.title: Fun toy
customer_reviews.text: Neat toy, only complaint is it doesn't cone with enough peices to build some of the things in the pamphlet..... if you put together one thing, you dont enough of the bigger blocks to build even one other thing. Just two or three more big blocks would make it perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Mandi Freeman

customer_reviews.title: Mind building kit!
customer_reviews.text: My grandson ( Five-years-old ) loves to sit and build things. There are a few small pieces in this kit if you have smaller children, so please beware. He loves to screw on pieces together in order to build his cars. Wheels on the car works and rolls well too. The tool he uses to screw pieces on comes with the kit. I didn’t have to provide directions, he just looked at the pictures in the given pamphlet to build his cars and other creations.
customer_reviews.author: DMC

customer_reviews.title: Challenges the mind-without Electronics😊
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my daughters 3rd grade classroom off her Amazon Teacher wish list-and one of my 5 year old twin grands got ahold of it and started creating! He loved it! I am sure the students in mom’s 3rd grade class will as well! It is perfect for the “brain bin” activity sets my daughter has at each pod in her room! I think she will add more of these to her Teacher Wish List-a great activity for various ages!
customer_reviews.author: Jamie M

customer_reviews.title: Great learning center!
customer_reviews.text: I’m a preschool teacher and my kids love this! It kept them entertained during centers and they even preferred it to water beads (which is a huge accomplishment)! My only issue is that there aren’t a lot of pieces and, even with 4 screwdrivers/tools, it’s hard to stretch this into a 4 child learning center. With that in mind, I would recommend this to other teachers or even as a gift idea for parents to give to children.
customer_reviews.author: Monique Vargas

customer_reviews.title: One of our favorite toys!
customer_reviews.text: This is one of our favorite toys! My kids have been playing with these since they were 3 and 4 years old and the pictures are more than enough for them to figure out how to build the structures. We were gifted one small set and I bought another of the larger set so that all of my kids could build multiple things and they play with it nearly every day!
customer_reviews.author: A K

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic toy to keep minds busy!!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for our 2 grandsons (5 & 3 years old). It is fantastic! Kept them busy for well over an hour .. and they can’t wait to play with it again. I will be buying some additional pieces because to build multiple items at the same time you could use more screws and wheels. Would highly recommend this for creative play!
customer_reviews.author: Christine S

customer_reviews.title: Grandson Loved this, But wish there were a few more "building" blocks.
customer_reviews.text: Our grandson loved this and wanted to make a lot of the different projects shown, but found there was only one piece in the box that is shown in several different pictures. He made a "horse" and used the piece for the horse's head, then didn't want to take it off to build something else. I may order a few more pieces for him but wish the manufacturer would have thought about kids wanting to "keep" their projects intact.
customer_reviews.author: Kay

customer_reviews.title: This is a great product.  Buy it and help a small family-owned business keep on making great products.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 7 year old Grandson and he loves it. We watched him make a dog in about 2 minutes while we were on Facebook. I thought he would like the magnetic dart board the best. He loves building. I would buy this for any child, boy or girl. Sallyann Wagoner
customer_reviews.author: SaraJane

customer_reviews.title: Super
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the greats! My 4 year old grandson loves it and I have to admit I do too! Comes with a great container which I love and the building ideas sheets. We have done many of them. We do have a separate container for all the bolts and tool. Makes it a little easier to find what you need.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fun and constructive
customer_reviews.text: My twin four year old grandsons love this toy. We make things based on the instructions and lots of things from their imagination. I supplemented with a few extra parts I ordered separately to be able to make more things, but there are enough pieces in this set to make plenty of stuff. Lots of fun and educational.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Pretty awesome
customer_reviews.text: Pretty cool for my 6 year old son who is curious about building and told, I do wish it came with more pieces but it's still pretty great... The tools and screws make it way more entertaining... Just not for kids who don't really understand how to use tools yet...
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa

customer_reviews.title: Fun fun fun
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my grandkids.... to keep at my house when they come over . Ages 3-7 and they love it ! They are using their imagination and every time they build it is something new ! Two sets would even be better... so I am going to get another set . When three boys are building we need more parts . Great for one or two kids more than two kids you really need two sets
customer_reviews.author: kj florida

customer_reviews.title: Best toy for 3 and up!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic set. Originally received for my kids third birthday. My twins (male and female) loved playing with the set each day. I eventually bought this additional set so they wouldn’t run out of pieces. A year later and it’s still used daily. It’s amazing what they can make.
customer_reviews.author: I Read Too Many Reviews B4 Buying

customer_reviews.title: It's a hit
customer_reviews.text: 6-year old grabs the box and builds crane truck, car, train, 6 wheeler trucks and what not. Daddy to 6-year old: Oh, that's an excellent construction set. 6-year old to daddy: Very super mega excellent! Suggestion for improvement: Make (some of) the bolts longer so that they can join 3 parts (or more).
customer_reviews.author: earlgrey

customer_reviews.title: Great StEM Activity
customer_reviews.text: The is a great set. I would say this is good for kids aged 3-8. It would be great if they would laminate the construction guide so that it didn't get ripped.
customer_reviews.author: Jos

customer_reviews.title: Boys and their toys
customer_reviews.text: But this for my son, he absolutely loves it. This was a great find and great price. Easy to wash , use, and travel with.
customer_reviews.author: Roselyn

customer_reviews.title: Best Toy for 5 year old boy, whose parents refuse to buy him a tablet.
customer_reviews.text: This is the best thing we could have gotten for our 5 year old son. He LOVES it, it makes him think, problem solve, chat to himself while he works through building things. We keep our kids low tech and this has really made our little guy light up with curiosity and pride when he completes a project. Thank you for helping keep our kids, kids!!
customer_reviews.author: M. M. D

customer_reviews.title: Extremely Captivating!
customer_reviews.text: While we bought this STEM kit for our 3 and 5 year old grandsons, it only took a few minutes before the entire family was on the floor playing! With such a variety of sizes and shapes the possibilities were endless for creativity. The kit comes in a nice box for storage and the pieces are very well made. What we liked most is how captive this toy kept the kids. We thought it was just because it was a NEW toy, but turns out every chance they get this is the toy the kids want to play with most! Also, "Sellers" described the toy properly and packaged it well. It arrived on time as promised.
customer_reviews.author: Mitch R.

customer_reviews.title: Hours of fun and creativity
customer_reviews.text: My family loves this building set!! So many fun things to build and the instructions are very easy to follow. Good fun for both my 5 and 3 year old! They have built so many things on their own as well as things from the idea poster. I would order this set again and recommend it to friends and family. I love that this set works for multiple ages! Clean up is also a breeze thanks to the handy bucket and top. This allows my crew to keep up with all the pieces.
customer_reviews.author: Tish

customer_reviews.title: Wishing for more wheels (but they still love it)
customer_reviews.text: My PreK students love this set! It involves some problem solving and some teamwork. The kids look at the idea page for a reference and then build on their own. I only wish there were more wheels as they are naturally drawn to building vehicles.
customer_reviews.author: csmc

customer_reviews.title: Two thumbs down
customer_reviews.text: I dont like this product. My wheels dont work without twisting off or twisting till they dont move n e more. The bolts arnt log enough to connect two pieces across. My kid played with it one time and hasnt touched it since.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Missing some blocks
customer_reviews.text: My son and I love this new toy. The only reason I gave it 3 stars is because we didn't receive any 2 block size. Almost 1/2 of the figurines need a 2 block size to create the correct figurine. We improvised, but again it sucks because it doesn't look exactly like the pictures/images.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Davila

customer_reviews.title: Magnet Tiles Are Better
customer_reviews.text: 5, 6, 7, 9. Not interested. They like the magnet tiles a lot better. Too hard for my 5 and 6, it made them extremely frustrated.
customer_reviews.author: Buffy

customer_reviews.title: 5 star from all accounts
customer_reviews.text: This item was bought as a gift for a 3 year old, and from all accounts--telephone thank you as well as photos of him playing with his surprise-- it was a big hit. I only went by the item picture and description, so we'll have to take the 3 year old's big smile and excited voice as testament to it.
customer_reviews.author: K.Gutheil

customer_reviews.title: Great sturdy toy
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my 3 year old. He loves it. He doesnt fully do this solo yet. He can sit for an hour and play with them but still needs help tightening and building them. His 12 and 10 year old cousins had a lot of fun building things with him. Great for all ages. Love that it comes with multiple tools and it's own case.
customer_reviews.author: EL King

customer_reviews.title: Fast
customer_reviews.text: The shipping was fast. There was not as many magnets as I thought there would be.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Ratliff

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my grandson who just turned 6. He received several boxes of Legos for gifts and was excited to receive those, but evidently will need help from his dad. Dad actually groaned. My grandson layed the Brickyard packaged aside but tore into it later and began building on his own and was proudly showing all of us what he had done. His dad had a big smile on his face, too. A hit!!!
customer_reviews.author: Babi

customer_reviews.title: Kids love it
customer_reviews.text: My kids can't wait a second once the box is arrived. They just follow the instruction and do the assembly all by themselves. The package includes a storage box which is very nice. They put the pieces back when it's done. No more mess.
customer_reviews.author: David L.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent STEM toy!
customer_reviews.text: Kept my five year old busy for hours! Even his 9 and 12 year old siblings joined in and had fun creating. Bought again for my 6 and 3 year old nieces. Again, kept them entertained for hours! Excellent toy- encourages STEM learning and independent, creative play. The tools really work and the kids all loved it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Too weak for a 4 year old
customer_reviews.text: My son is 4 year old and he is enjoying the bricks but 3 times so far the structures dropped from his hand while he was standing and the L shape brackets keep breaking. The other time, I tightened the screw a little more and that broke the longest plate. I signed up for additional warranty, will probably ask for some replacements parts.
customer_reviews.author: KT

customer_reviews.title: 4 year old loves building
customer_reviews.text: Great STEM set for 4 year old. My son has fun picking out what we are going to make and following through. I’m sure he will enjoy it more using his imagination too. Great product, easy to understand for kids.
customer_reviews.author: Christa L

customer_reviews.title: Our Grandchildren Love These
customer_reviews.text: One of the best modern gifts for children - from older toddlers through grade school. My 3-year old can assemble them and they are still interesting to his 8-year old brother. Highly recommend to any parent or grandparent.
customer_reviews.author: Ideas&Opins

customer_reviews.title: My three year old loves it.
customer_reviews.text: While attending a Halloween party, my son found the hosts' kid's set of these, and was in his glory for practically the entire evening. I purchased his own set. Now, from the second he gets in the door after daycare until bed time, all he wants to play with is this.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Cina

customer_reviews.title: Fun!
customer_reviews.text: Mine came with a broken box and the seller was quick to send me a new one since it was a hazard with sharp objects for my kid. My little one loves this and gets very creative with making stuff. Hours of fun!
customer_reviews.author: Allen Fong

customer_reviews.title: Immediately a hit.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this STEM kit for two of my little cousins ( girl age 7 boy age 4). I know they are easily bored and that something like this would keep them busy and occupied. WINNER! Not a peep from either of them for hours as they created new things. We had to ask them to stop playing so they could have dinner as they were so enthused.
customer_reviews.author: Rosa

customer_reviews.title: Creative building fun
customer_reviews.text: We played with this right away! Love that it has a container that latches closed so his baby brother cannot open it and choke on the bolts. Bright primary colors to learn while playing. A large picture guide poster with several different objects to build. He is 3 and just grasping the concept of tools so this is a lot of fun for us to do together or him to do by himself. Great purchase!!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Build, Create, use your Imagination
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome kit to purchase for your child to use his/her imagination and create. I purchased this for a 5yr old who loves to build and put things together and he has really enjoyed it. It does come with a booklet that shows your child a few of the things that they can create and build. With so many toys going more over to the tech side it was refreshing to find a toy that pulls them away to use their own imagination!
customer_reviews.author: D Long

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased
customer_reviews.text: As a grandma, you just don't know if you are getting the age appropriate toy or not. My 7 yr/o grandson enjoyed playing with this toy all weekend and was able to follow the instructions for building many different items. I was very pleased with the purchase
customer_reviews.author: quilter105

customer_reviews.title: Super fun, a little stressful
customer_reviews.text: My sons love it! 5 and 3!they spend hours building. At first we were a little disappointed it didnt have step by step instructions but once they practiced their skills keep getting better and better. My only problem is that the kit needs more big pieces. I feel like double the size of the big blocks instead of all the extras that you cant use if you have something built. 8 had to buy 2 sets just so my sons can build more cool things. And when I tried to buy extra parts that was not an option so yeah kinda sucked. But other than that my kids really love this!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cool you, not super durable though
customer_reviews.text: These are pretty cool to build things. I deducted a star for durability. My 7 year old daughter was able to tighten the screw too tight and it seemed like it broke way to easily. Fun to play with, just be gentle with them. My 5 and 2 year old boys enjoy these
customer_reviews.author: rachel

customer_reviews.title: High quality & fun!
customer_reviews.text: I almost got the more expensive brand but decided on this one instead. The pieces were high quality and my son (4 yo) loves it! It doesn’t come with directions, so my son had a lot of fun getting creative. I love that this is something that he can grow up with and continue using. I also like that it comes in a container for easy clean-up.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Great Construction Set
customer_reviews.text: My almost 4 year granddaughter and myself love this construction set. Just the right size for her small hands. 5 Stars. Buy this! Price is great too. Ordering some additional pieces (less than $20) this week so we can keep some built without tearing them down to build others.
customer_reviews.author: No If And Or Buts

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME TO KEEP KIDS BUSY!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these for my 5 year old daughter & 3 year old son. I work from home so I try to keep stuff to entertain them around all the time. Lego's just weren't doing it anymore. They play with these for hours!!!!! GREAT toy recommend for a gift especially. Not normally something I would but. Sure glad I did!
customer_reviews.author: Getana

customer_reviews.title: Great product, bright colors, great price
customer_reviews.text: This was a Christmas gift for my 5 year old and he has spent at least 5 hours every day for almost a week. He loves it and it has a good balance between complex and simple building. I'd recommend this product for toddlers 3+
customer_reviews.author: Julian

customer_reviews.title: Just okay
customer_reviews.text: I’ve played with this toy myself along with my 3 year old son. If the treads are not carved out correctly, and I have a lot of pieces that are this way, it’s very frustrating if not impossible to make things.
customer_reviews.author: LJ

customer_reviews.title: Old School Toys
customer_reviews.text: I prefer old school toys to electronics. There are already too many 18 month olds playing with phones. I have "gifted" these kits multiple times - to boys and girls. I think STEM toys are a great idea.
customer_reviews.author: Francisco Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Fun toy for kids that love to build
customer_reviews.text: My four year old son enjoys this toy. He is able to build things with minimal assistance. My only complaint is that the bolts don't always stay tightened so I'm often having to tighten them to make his projects stay together properly.
customer_reviews.author: Brittney W.

customer_reviews.title: Build stuff
customer_reviews.text: My 5 year old daughter loves building with these. She uses the included fold out example paper to build the various examples with no help. She loves the drivers and wrenches included with the set because it allows her to have tools just like dad.
customer_reviews.author: Rat Dog

customer_reviews.title: Provides hours of entertainment
customer_reviews.text: Couldn't review when asked in previous emails because I hadn't given the present to my great nephew yet. He and his younger brother loved it! At 5, he was able to use the pictures to construct some of the toys and also able to persuade the adults to help on some that were more complicated. Tools were appropriate for his age. And there are plenty of pieces!
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia Potter Smith

customer_reviews.title: Hours of Entertainment
customer_reviews.text: These kept the attention of my 6, 5, 3 year old and husband for HOURS. Their only complaint is that I should have bought 2 sets because they want more pieces. You can find individual pieces on the company's website but I'd actually really recommend buying 2 of these, especially if you have multiple kids.
customer_reviews.author: SnappinMom

customer_reviews.title: cracked container but good amount of pieces
customer_reviews.text: I really like the product but the container it comes in was cracked. Im a bit disappointing it isn't more sturdy... especially considering it is a kids toy storage bin.
customer_reviews.author: Darci M Yeary

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Got these to give the kiddos some challenge with playing blocks. These are great. Love how the kids pick out what they going to build n gets straight to work. Would definitely recommend. These were even nice in my class when I was teaching.
customer_reviews.author: kysha

customer_reviews.title: Stem fun
customer_reviews.text: I was happy that it was available, not over priced. It arrived just in time to be a birthday present. The pieces are large enough for little fingers to manipulate.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: 163 Piece STEM Toys Kit, Educational Construction Engineering Building Blocks Learning Set for Ages 3 4 5 6 7 8 9 10 Year Old Boys & Girls by Brickyard, Best Kids Toy, Creative Games & Fun Activity
feature_bullets: 75% MORE PIECES THAN OTHER SIMILAR SETS, UP TO 6 PLAYERS CAN PLAY AT THE SAME TIME - We give you MORE blocks, MORE wrenches, MORE movable wheels, MORE plates, and MORE nuts & bolts than any other set. Because we're so confident you'll love our STEM Construction Engineering Building Blocks, it's backed by our NO-HASSLE SATISFACTION GUARANTEE. If you don't love it for any reason, you can return it for a full refund.

SUPPORTS STEM EDUCATION - Designed to enhance your children's Science, Technology, Engineering, and Math skills. Improve your kids' imagination and creativity by challenging them to build their own cars, animals, robots and anything they can imagine! Our educational building blocks grow with your child, too! We include a large, full-color guide with 42 designs your kids can build, starting from easy for younger kids to advanced designs for older kids.

GIFT A TOY THAT ENCOURAGES YOUR CHILD TO LEARN THROUGH PLAY - Specially created to help your child develop hand-eye coordination, master fine motor skills, improve logical thinking, & boost vital problem solving skills. It's the ultimate toy that also promotes the importance of teamwork & collaboration, builds social skills, supports creativity, and improves imagination through interactive play.

HASSLE-FREE ENJOYMENT GUARANTEED - Brickyard Building Blocks STEM Construction Engineering Kits are easy to wash and come with a sturdy storage box for quick and convenient cleanups. Each of the 163 bright, colorful, non-toxic pieces are certified Phthalate, Lead, Cadmium, and BPA-free. We invested in child-friendly materials and rigorous lab tests to make sure your kids are 100% safe from harmful chemicals.

NEW SUPERIOR DESIGNS GIVE YOU MORE WAYS TO PLAY - Our bolts are custom designed with a built-in screwdriver slot so they can be used with either the wrench or the screwdriver to allow for even more ways to build. We also give you MORE tools than other sets: Four (4) dual-purpose "clicking" wrenches, a kid-friendly screwdriver, & a special combination wrench so more of your kids can play at the same time.
